register.name: ACTLR
register.description: Provides IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED configuration and control options.

register.name: ACTLR2
register.description: Provides additional space to the ACTLR register to hold IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED trap functionality.

register.name: CPACR
register.description: Controls access to Trace, Floating-point, and Advanced SIMD functionality.

bitField.name: ASEDIS
bitField.description: Disables PL0 and PL1 execution of Advanced SIMD instructions.

bitField.name: TRCDIS
bitField.description: Traps PL0 and PL1 CP14 accesses to all implemented trace registers to Undefined mode.

bitField.name: cp11
bitField.description: Defines the access rights for coprocessors 10 and 11, which control the floating-point and Advanced SIMD features.

bitField.name: cp10
bitField.description: Defines the access rights for coprocessors 10 and 11, which control the floating-point and Advanced SIMD features.

register.name: HACTLR
register.description: Controls IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED features of Hyp mode operation.

register.name: HACTLR2
register.description: Provides additional space to the HACTLR register to hold IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED trap functionality.

register.name: HSCTLR
register.description: Provides top level control of the system operation in Hyp mode. This register provides Hyp mode control of features controlled by the Banked SCTLR bits, and shows the values of the non-Banked SCTLR bits.

bitField.name: TE
bitField.description: T32 Exception Enable.

bitField.name: EE
bitField.description: The value of the PSTATE.E bit on entry to Hyp mode, the endianness of stage 1 translation table walks in the PL2 translation regime, and the endianness of stage 2 translation table walks in the PL1&0 translation regime.

bitField.name: WXN
bitField.description: Write permission implies XN (Execute Never). This bit can be used to require all memory regions with write permission to be treated as XN for the EL2 translation regime.

bitField.name: I
bitField.description: Instruction cache enable.

bitField.name: SED
bitField.description: SETEND instruction disable. Disables SETEND instructions at PL2.

bitField.name: ITD
bitField.description: IT Disable. Disables some uses of IT instructions at PL2.

bitField.name: CP15BEN
bitField.description: CP15 barrier operation instruction enable. Enables accesses to the CP15 DMB, DSB, and ISB barrier operations from PL2.

bitField.name: C
bitField.description: Cache enable, for data caching.

bitField.name: A
bitField.description: Alignment check enable.

bitField.name: M
bitField.description: MMU enable for EL2 stage 1 address translation.

register.name: SCTLR
register.description: Provides the top level control of the system, including its memory system.

bitField.name: TE
bitField.description: T32 Exception Enable.

bitField.name: AFE
bitField.description: Access Flag Enable. When using the Short-descriptor translation table format for the PL1&0 translation regime, this bit enables use of the AP[0] bit in the translation descriptors as the Access flag, and restricts access permissions in the translation descriptors to the simplified model.

bitField.name: TRE
bitField.description: TEX remap enable. This bit enables remapping of the TEX[2:1] bits in the PL1&0 translation regime for use as two translation table bits that can be managed by the operating system. Enabling this remapping also changes the scheme used to describe the memory region attributes in the VMSA.

bitField.name: EE
bitField.description: The value of the PSTATE.E bit on branch to an exception vector or coming out of reset, and the endianness of stage 1 translation table walks in the PL1&0 translation regime.

bitField.name: UWXN
bitField.description: Unprivileged write permission implies EL1 XN (Execute Never). This bit can be used to require all memory regions with unprivileged write permissions to be treated as XN for accesses from software executing at EL1.

bitField.name: WXN
bitField.description: Write permission implies XN (Execute Never). This bit can be used to require all memory regions with write permission to be treated as XN for the PL1&0 translation regime.

bitField.name: nTWE
bitField.description: Traps PL0 execution of WFE instructions to Undefined mode.

bitField.name: nTWI
bitField.description: Traps PL0 execution of WFI instructions to Undefined mode.

bitField.name: V
bitField.description: Vectors bit.

bitField.name: I
bitField.description: Instruction cache enable.

bitField.name: SED
bitField.description: SETEND instruction disable. Disables SETEND instructions at PL0 and PL1.

bitField.name: ITD
bitField.description: IT Disable. Disables some uses of IT instructions at PL1 and PL0.

bitField.name: UNK
bitField.description: Writes to this bit are IGNORED. Reads of this bit return an UNKNOWN value.

bitField.name: CP15BEN
bitField.description: CP15 barrier operation instruction enable.

bitField.name: C
bitField.description: Cache enable, for data caching.

bitField.name: A
bitField.description: Alignment check enable.

bitField.name: M
bitField.description: MMU enable for EL1 and EL0 stage 1 address translation.

tcf:enumItem.description: Advanced SIMD instructions are enabled at PL0 and PL1.
tcf:enumItem.name: Advanced_SIMD_instructions_are_enabled_at_PL0_and_PL1

tcf:enumItem.description: All instruction encodings that are Advanced SIMD instruction encodings, but are also not floating-point instruction encodings, are UNDEFINED.
tcf:enumItem.name: All_instruction_encodings_that_are_Advanced_SIMD_instruction_encodings_but_are_also_not_floating_point_instruction_encodings_are_UNDEFINED

tcf:enumItem.description: PL0 and PL1 CP14 accesses to all implemented trace registers are not trapped to Undefined mode.
tcf:enumItem.name: PL0_and_PL1_CP14_accesses_to_all_implemented_trace_registers_are_not_trapped_to_Undefined_mode

tcf:enumItem.description: PL0 and PL1 CP14 accesses to all implemented trace registers are trapped to Undefined mode.
tcf:enumItem.name: PL0_and_PL1_CP14_accesses_to_all_implemented_trace_registers_are_trapped_to_Undefined_mode

tcf:enumItem.description: PL0 and PL1 accesses to floating-point and Advanced SIMD registers or instructions are UNDEFINED.
tcf:enumItem.name: PL0_and_PL1_accesses_to_floating_point_and_Advanced_SIMD_registers_or_instructions_are_UNDEFINED

tcf:enumItem.description: PL0 accesses to floating-point and Advanced SIMD registers or instructions are UNDEFINED.
tcf:enumItem.name: PL0_accesses_to_floating_point_and_Advanced_SIMD_registers_or_instructions_are_UNDEFINED

tcf:enumItem.description: Full access from PL0 and PL1.
tcf:enumItem.name: Full_access_from_PL0_and_PL1

tcf:enumItem.description: Exceptions, including reset, taken to A32 state.
tcf:enumItem.name: Exceptions_including_reset_taken_to_A32_state

tcf:enumItem.description: Exceptions, including reset, taken to T32 state.
tcf:enumItem.name: Exceptions_including_reset_taken_to_T32_state

tcf:enumItem.description: Little-endian. PSTATE.E is cleared to 0 on entry to Hyp mode. Stage 1 translation table walks in the PL2 translation regime, and stage 2 translation table walks in the PL1&0 translation regime are little-endian.
tcf:enumItem.name: Little_endian

tcf:enumItem.description: Big-endian. PSTATE.E is set to 1 on entry to Hyp mode. Stage 1 translation table walks in the PL2 translation regime, and stage 2 translation table walks in the PL1&0 translation regime are big-endian.
tcf:enumItem.name: Big_endian

tcf:enumItem.description: Regions with write permission are not forced to XN.
tcf:enumItem.name: Regions_with_write_permission_are_not_forced_to_XN

tcf:enumItem.description: Regions with write permission are forced to XN for the EL2 translation regime.
tcf:enumItem.name: Regions_with_write_permission_are_forced_to_XN_for_the_EL2_translation_regime

tcf:enumItem.description: All instruction access to Normal memory from EL2 are Non-cacheable for all levels of instruction and unified cache. If the value of HSCTLR.M is 0, instruction accesses from stage 1 of the EL2 translation regime are to Normal, Outer Shareable, Inner Non-cacheable, Outer Non-cacheable memory.
tcf:enumItem.name: All_instruction_access_to_Normal_memory_from_EL2_are_Non_cacheable_for_all_levels_of_instruction_and_unified_cache

tcf:enumItem.description: All instruction access to Normal memory from EL2 can be cached at all levels of instruction and unified cache. If the value of HSCTLR.M is 0, instruction accesses from stage 1 of the EL2 translation regime are to Normal, Outer Shareable, Inner Write-Through, Outer Write-Through memory.
tcf:enumItem.name: All_instruction_access_to_Normal_memory_from_EL2_can_be_cached_at_all_levels_of_instruction_and_unified_cache

tcf:enumItem.description: SETEND instruction execution is enabled at PL2.
tcf:enumItem.name: SETEND_instruction_execution_is_enabled_at_PL2

tcf:enumItem.description: SETEND instructions are UNDEFINED at PL2.
tcf:enumItem.name: SETEND_instructions_are_UNDEFINED_at_PL2

tcf:enumItem.description: All IT instruction functionality is enabled at PL2.
tcf:enumItem.name: All_IT_instruction_functionality_is_enabled_at_PL2

tcf:enumItem.description: Any attempt at PL2 to execute any of the following is UNDEFINED: These instructions are always UNDEFINED, regardless of whether they would pass or fail the condition code check that applies to them as a result of being in an IT block. It is IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED whether the IT instruction is treated as: This means that, for the situations that are UNDEFINED, either the second 16-bit instruction or the 32-bit instruction is UNDEFINED. An implementation might vary dynamically as to whether IT is treated as a 16-bit instruction or the first half of a 32-bit instruction.
tcf:enumItem.name: Any_attempt_at_PL2_to_execute_any_of_the_following_is_UNDEFINED_These_instructions_are_always_UNDEFINED_regardless_of_whether_they_would_pass_or_fail_the_condition_code_check_that_applies_to_them_as_a_result_of_being_in_an_IT_block

tcf:enumItem.description: PL2 execution of the CP15DMB, CP15DSB, and CP15ISB instructions is UNDEFINED.
tcf:enumItem.name: PL2_execution_of_the_CP15DMB_CP15DSB_and_CP15ISB_instructions_is_UNDEFINED

tcf:enumItem.description: PL2 execution of the CP15DMB, CP15DSB, and CP15ISB instructions is enabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: PL2_execution_of_the_CP15DMB_CP15DSB_and_CP15ISB_instructions_is_enabled

tcf:enumItem.description: All data access to Normal memory from EL2, and all accesses to the EL2 translation tables, are Non-cacheable for all levels of data and unified cache.
tcf:enumItem.name: All_data_access_to_Normal_memory_from_EL2_and_all_accesses_to_the_EL2_translation_tables_are_Non_cacheable_for_all_levels_of_data_and_unified_cache

tcf:enumItem.description: All data access to Normal memory from EL2, and all accesses to the EL2 translation tables, can be cached at all levels of data and unified cache.
tcf:enumItem.name: All_data_access_to_Normal_memory_from_EL2_and_all_accesses_to_the_EL2_translation_tables_can_be_cached_at_all_levels_of_data_and_unified_cache

tcf:enumItem.description: Alignment fault checking disabled when executing at EL2. Instructions that load or store one or more registers, other than load/store exclusive and load-acquire/store-release, do not check that the address being accessed is aligned to the size of the data element(s) being accessed.
tcf:enumItem.name: Alignment_fault_checking_disabled_when_executing_at_EL2

tcf:enumItem.description: Alignment fault checking enabled when executing at EL2. All instructions that load or store one or more registers have an alignment check that the address being accessed is aligned to the size of the data element(s) being accessed. If this check fails it causes an Alignment fault, which is taken as a Data Abort exception.
tcf:enumItem.name: Alignment_fault_checking_enabled_when_executing_at_EL2

tcf:enumItem.description: EL2 stage 1 address translation disabled. See the HSCTLR.I field for the behavior of instruction accesses to Normal memory.
tcf:enumItem.name: EL2_stage_1_address_translation_disabled

tcf:enumItem.description: EL2 stage 1 address translation enabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: EL2_stage_1_address_translation_enabled

tcf:enumItem.description: Exceptions, including reset, taken to A32 state.
tcf:enumItem.name: Exceptions_including_reset_taken_to_A32_state

tcf:enumItem.description: Exceptions, including reset, taken to T32 state.
tcf:enumItem.name: Exceptions_including_reset_taken_to_T32_state

tcf:enumItem.description: In the translation table descriptors, AP[0] is an access permissions bit. The full range of access permissions is supported. No Access flag is implemented.
tcf:enumItem.name: In_the_translation_table_descriptors_AP_0_is_an_access_permissions_bit

tcf:enumItem.description: In the translation table descriptors, AP[0] is the Access flag. Only the simplified model for access permissions is supported.
tcf:enumItem.name: In_the_translation_table_descriptors_AP_0_is_the_Access_flag

tcf:enumItem.description: TEX remap disabled. TEX[2:0] are used, with the C and B bits, to describe the memory region attributes.
tcf:enumItem.name: TEX_remap_disabled

tcf:enumItem.description: TEX remap enabled. TEX[2:1] are reassigned for use as bits managed by the operating system. The TEX[0], C, and B bits are used to describe the memory region attributes, with the MMU remap registers.
tcf:enumItem.name: TEX_remap_enabled

tcf:enumItem.description: Little-endian. PSTATE.E is cleared to 0 on taking an exception or coming out of reset. Stage 1 translation table walks in the PL1&0 translation regime are little-endian.
tcf:enumItem.name: Little_endian

tcf:enumItem.description: Big-endian. PSTATE.E is cleared to 0 on taking an exception or coming out of reset. Stage 1 translation table walks in the PL1&0 translation regime are big-endian.
tcf:enumItem.name: Big_endian

tcf:enumItem.description: Regions with unprivileged write permission are not forced to XN.
tcf:enumItem.name: Regions_with_unprivileged_write_permission_are_not_forced_to_XN

tcf:enumItem.description: Regions with unprivileged write permission are forced to XN for accesses from software executing at EL1.
tcf:enumItem.name: Regions_with_unprivileged_write_permission_are_forced_to_XN_for_accesses_from_software_executing_at_EL1

tcf:enumItem.description: Regions with write permission are not forced to XN.
tcf:enumItem.name: Regions_with_write_permission_are_not_forced_to_XN

tcf:enumItem.description: Regions with write permission are forced to XN for the PL1&0 translation regime.
tcf:enumItem.name: Regions_with_write_permission_are_forced_to_XN_for_the_PL1_0_translation_regime

tcf:enumItem.description: Any attempt to execute a WFE instruction at PL0 is trapped to Undefined mode, if the instruction would otherwise have caused the PE to enter a low-power state.
tcf:enumItem.name: Any_attempt_to_execute_a_WFE_instruction_at_PL0_is_trapped_to_Undefined_mode_if_the_instruction_would_otherwise_have_caused_the_PE_to_enter_a_low_power_state

tcf:enumItem.description: PL0 execution of WFE instructions is not trapped to Undefined mode.
tcf:enumItem.name: PL0_execution_of_WFE_instructions_is_not_trapped_to_Undefined_mode

tcf:enumItem.description: Any attempt to execute a WFI instruction at PL0 is trapped to Undefined mode, if the instruction would otherwise have caused the PE to enter a low-power state.
tcf:enumItem.name: Any_attempt_to_execute_a_WFI_instruction_at_PL0_is_trapped_to_Undefined_mode_if_the_instruction_would_otherwise_have_caused_the_PE_to_enter_a_low_power_state

tcf:enumItem.description: PL0 execution of WFI instructions is not trapped to Undefined mode.
tcf:enumItem.name: PL0_execution_of_WFI_instructions_is_not_trapped_to_Undefined_mode

tcf:enumItem.description: Normal exception vectors. Base address is held in:
tcf:enumItem.name: Normal_exception_vectors

tcf:enumItem.description: High exception vectors (Hivecs), base address 0xFFFF0000. This base address is never remapped.
tcf:enumItem.name: High_exception_vectors_Hivecs_base_address_0xFFFF0000

tcf:enumItem.description: All instruction access to Normal memory from PL1 and PL0 are Non-cacheable for all levels of instruction and unified cache. If the value of SCTLR.M is 0, instruction accesses from stage 1 of the PL1&0 translation regime are to Normal, Outer Shareable, Inner Non-cacheable, Outer Non-cacheable memory.
tcf:enumItem.name: All_instruction_access_to_Normal_memory_from_PL1_and_PL0_are_Non_cacheable_for_all_levels_of_instruction_and_unified_cache

tcf:enumItem.description: All instruction access to Normal memory from PL1 and PL0 can be cached at all levels of instruction and unified cache. If the value of SCTLR.M is 0, instruction accesses from stage 1 of the PL1&0 translation regime are to Normal, Outer Shareable, Inner Write-Through, Outer Write-Through memory.
tcf:enumItem.name: All_instruction_access_to_Normal_memory_from_PL1_and_PL0_can_be_cached_at_all_levels_of_instruction_and_unified_cache

tcf:enumItem.description: SETEND instruction execution is enabled at PL0 and PL1.
tcf:enumItem.name: SETEND_instruction_execution_is_enabled_at_PL0_and_PL1

tcf:enumItem.description: SETEND instructions are UNDEFINED at PL0 and PL1.
tcf:enumItem.name: SETEND_instructions_are_UNDEFINED_at_PL0_and_PL1

tcf:enumItem.description: All IT instruction functionality is enabled at PL1 and PL0.
tcf:enumItem.name: All_IT_instruction_functionality_is_enabled_at_PL1_and_PL0

tcf:enumItem.description: Any attempt at PL1 or PL0 to execute any of the following is UNDEFINED: These instructions are always UNDEFINED, regardless of whether they would pass or fail the condition code check that applies to them as a result of being in an IT block. It is IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED whether the IT instruction is treated as: This means that, for the situations that are UNDEFINED, either the second 16-bit instruction or the 32-bit instruction is UNDEFINED. An implementation might vary dynamically as to whether IT is treated as a 16-bit instruction or the first half of a 32-bit instruction.
tcf:enumItem.name: Any_attempt_at_PL1_or_PL0_to_execute_any_of_the_following_is_UNDEFINED_These_instructions_are_always_UNDEFINED_regardless_of_whether_they_would_pass_or_fail_the_condition_code_check_that_applies_to_them_as_a_result_of_being_in_an_IT_block

tcf:enumItem.description: PL0 and PL1 execution of the CP15DMB, CP15DSB, and CP15ISB instructions is UNDEFINED.
tcf:enumItem.name: PL0_and_PL1_execution_of_the_CP15DMB_CP15DSB_and_CP15ISB_instructions_is_UNDEFINED

tcf:enumItem.description: PL0 and PL1 execution of the CP15DMB, CP15DSB, and CP15ISB instructions is enabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: PL0_and_PL1_execution_of_the_CP15DMB_CP15DSB_and_CP15ISB_instructions_is_enabled

tcf:enumItem.description: All data access to Normal memory from PL1 and PL0, and all accesses to the PL1&0 stage 1 translation tables, are Non-cacheable for all levels of data and unified cache.
tcf:enumItem.name: All_data_access_to_Normal_memory_from_PL1_and_PL0_and_all_accesses_to_the_PL1_0_stage_1_translation_tables_are_Non_cacheable_for_all_levels_of_data_and_unified_cache

tcf:enumItem.description: All data access to Normal memory from PL1 and PL0, and all accesses to the PL1&0 stage 1 translation tables, can be cached at all levels of data and unified cache.
tcf:enumItem.name: All_data_access_to_Normal_memory_from_PL1_and_PL0_and_all_accesses_to_the_PL1_0_stage_1_translation_tables_can_be_cached_at_all_levels_of_data_and_unified_cache

tcf:enumItem.description: Alignment fault checking disabled when executing at PL1 or PL0. Instructions that load or store one or more registers, other than load/store exclusive and load-acquire/store-release, do not check that the address being accessed is aligned to the size of the data element(s) being accessed.
tcf:enumItem.name: Alignment_fault_checking_disabled_when_executing_at_PL1_or_PL0

tcf:enumItem.description: Alignment fault checking enabled when executing at PL1 or PL0. All instructions that load or store one or more registers have an alignment check that the address being accessed is aligned to the size of the data element(s) being accessed. If this check fails it causes an Alignment fault, which is taken as a Data Abort exception.
tcf:enumItem.name: Alignment_fault_checking_enabled_when_executing_at_PL1_or_PL0

tcf:enumItem.description: EL1 and EL0 stage 1 address translation disabled. See the SCTLR.I field for the behavior of instruction accesses to Normal memory.
tcf:enumItem.name: EL1_and_EL0_stage_1_address_translation_disabled

tcf:enumItem.description: EL1 and EL0 stage 1 address translation enabled.
tcf:enumItem.name: EL1_and_EL0_stage_1_address_translation_enabled
